Profile:   
• Certified Project Management Professional with over 18+ years of experience within the Information Technology. 
Proven expertise across diverse roles, including Project and Program Management, and as a proficient Technical 
Manager.  
• Adept  at  navigating  both  Agile,  Hybrid  and  Water-fall projects,  consistently  delivering  successful  outcomes  in 
Program and Project Management and Service Delivery Management.  
• Demonstrated ability to manage projects across global locations, fostering collaboration between Client, Vendor 
and as well as external teams.  
• Extensive experience in Project scope and Cost estimation techniques  
• Extensive industry knowledge spans across Telecom, Insurance and Utilities domains. 
• Extensive working experience in Public (The USA State Government) and Private sectors 
• Hands-on proficiency in cutting-edge technologies, including AWS, DevOps, and Python.

• Extensive working experience in Public (The USA State Government) and Private sectors 
• Hands-on proficiency in cutting-edge technologies, including AWS, DevOps, and Python.  
• Strong experience of Service Delivery Management, Infrastructure Project Management Methods and Processes, 
complemented by certification as a SCRUM Master and a certified SAFe Agilest.  
• Holds ITIL Foundation certification, further enhancing expertise in IT service management.

Key Achievements as EUT Scrum Master: E*TRADE Workflow Management System (WMS) Migration, this has been divided 
into 26 sprints.  As a Scrum Master overseeing the migration of E*TRADE’s WMS Application Migration responsibilities can be 
divided into four major areas:  
1. Sprint Planning and Backlog Refinement: 
o Backlog Refinement: Support the Product Owner and ensure the  product backlog is well-groomed, with all 
tasks related to the WMS migration are clearly defined, prioritized, and estimated.

o Backlog Refinement: Support the Product Owner and ensure the  product backlog is well-groomed, with all 
tasks related to the WMS migration are clearly defined, prioritized, and estimated.  
o Sprint Planning: Facilitate all sprint planning meetings to define sprint backlogs. 
 2. Facilitating Scrum Ceremonies  
o Fecilitate all Scrum Ceremonies, track all the tasks and follow-up with required stakeholders to complete the 
tasks on time 
o Daily Stand-ups 
o Sprint Reviews  
o Retrospectives 
3. Removing Impediments and Providing Support 
o Document all the impediments identified during sprint ceremonies  
o Get the right people addressed the impediments on time to help complete the sprint deliverables on time 
4. Training the team on Agile methodologies and Scrum processes and User Adoption 
o Ensure Team follows the Agile principles and scrum process  
o Conducting Training Programs 
o Use VersionOne (V1) to provide flow-based metrics to leadership 
5. PI Planning

o Ensure Team follows the Agile principles and scrum process  
o Conducting Training Programs 
o Use VersionOne (V1) to provide flow-based metrics to leadership 
5. PI Planning 
o Interact with PO and get the  Features for  next few Sprints and get them  reviewed with Dev  Team identify 
risks, issues, assumptions and dependencies. 
o Part of PI meeting and discuss with dependent teams and get the required support as needed 
o Track down the PI objectives and follow-up with respective teams to make sure tasks are completed on time
